page.title: 05The Hooke Estate Chailey
page.content: Major Tillard ons the Hooke Estate which covers about one third of Chailey. He showed the children from St Peters C.E. Primary around the Estate and they saw many interesting things. Major Tillard has carefully planted the woodland so oak trees will take over once the fir trees are cut down. He has planted a new tree whereever an old one has had to be felled. Young trees are all protected by special guards. In one place the hedge has been layered to take place of a wire fence. Two ponds have been cleared in order that pond life may thrive. All the very wet land has been left alone and orchids are growing on one wet patch.Even overhead electric cables are marked so wild birds will not fly into them.
